Header: Attention drawn to moving the case against Aluthgamage to the Permanent High Court
Content: Deputy Solicitor General Azad Navavi has informed the judiciary that inquiries will be made from the Chief Justice on taking up the case against former Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage in the Permanent High Court at Bar. This statement was made when the related case was convened today. Former Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage is accused of embezzling a sum of 53.1 million rupees in the purchase of sports gear while serving as Minister of Sports in 2014. The related case was taken up for hearing in the Colombo Chief Magistrateâ€™s Court today. Deputy Solicitor General Azad Navavi informed the judiciary that inquiries would be made from the Chief Justice whether to take up the case for hearing in the Permanent High Court at Bar or in the High Court. The case is due to be taken up again on the 16th of November.
